thread.title: Source: Matt Harvey could start World Series Game 1 over Jacob deGrom
thread.title_full: Source: Matt Harvey could start World Series Game 1 over Jacob deGrom

title: Source: Matt Harvey could start World Series Game 1 over Jacob deGrom
text:
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
The Mets' starting rotation in the World Series has essentially been set, a source told Newsday, with Jacob deGrom and Matt Harvey slated to pitch the first two games although their order has yet to be determined. 
Mets manager Terry Collins did not announce the rotation on Friday. However, he indicated that deGrom could use some extra rest after grinding through his last two postseason starts. 
advertisement | advertise on newsday 
For now, deGrom appears to be penciled in as the Game 1 starter on Tuesday, though a source indicated that the assignment could still fall to Harvey instead. Interactive How the 2015 Mets were built Database Explore every start of Matt Harvey's Mets career Interactive 1986 vs. 2015: Which Mets team is better? 
Noah Syndergaard will pitch in Game 3 at Citi Field followed by Long Island's Steven Matz in Game 4. 
Harvey had been slated to start Game 5 of the NLCS before the Mets completed a sweep of the Cubs. 
If deGrom gets the nod, he'd be pitching on seven days' rest where as Harvey would be on 10 days' rest.
